page.title: 06Hobbies of the children
page.content: The local children spend their free time in a variety of ways: horse riding and swimming are popular and one person helps the local farmer, whilst another goes flying. Thimble and stamp collecting, train spotting, fishing and judo are all popular. Most children belong to the Scouting Movement. The Beavers are boys aged between 6 and 8. They play games and make things. The cubs are aged 8-11. They salute the Union Jack during their meetings. They work hard for badges. They go camping. The scouts meet at Mears Ashby. They are aged between 11 and 15. They learn about knots, camping, firemaking, tracking and orienteering. The Brownies meet in Overstone WI Hall on a Friday evening. They are aged between 6 and 10. The guides meet at Sywell School. There is no youth club. A lot of children learn musical instruments.
